results.definition: the cognitive processes whereby past experience is remembered
examples: he can do it from memory

results.definition: recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection
examples: I can't remember saying any such thing
I can't think what her last name was
can you remember her phone number?
Do you remember that he once loved you?

results.definition: keep in mind for attention or consideration
examples: Remember to call your mother every day!
Think of the starving children in India!

results.definition: recapture the past; indulge in memories
examples: he remembered how he used to pick flowers
He remembered her in his will

results.definition: mention as by way of greeting or to indicate friendship
exercise, or have the power of, memory
examples: After the shelling, many people lost the ability to remember

results.definition: call to remembrance; keep alive the memory of someone or something, as in a ceremony
examples: We remembered the 50th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz
Remember the dead of the First World War
